definition: to lend money (as a commercial loan)
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
section/paragraph/funds/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]/classifier for versions or models (of a product)
funds on call/invested sum that can be cashed

sentences.english: But a broker who finds lenders for homebuyers offers you a deal.
sentences.chinese: 但經紀人發現，放款爲置業者提供了一種交易的機會。

sentences.english: Market is inundating with lenders , who are willing to give discounts .
sentences.chinese: 市場是迷倒與放款人，誰願意給予折扣。

sentences.english: Packing loan is an L/C-related trade financing form.
sentences.chinese: 打包放款是與信用證有關的貿易融資形式之一。

sentences.english: Interbank lending rates have come down and stabilized, but banks are not yet lending.
sentences.chinese: 同業拆借利率已經下調和穩定，但銀行尚未放款。

sentences.english: The company also plans to raise money from charitable foundations to lend out, with the interest being reinvested to fund further loans.
sentences.chinese: 這個公司爲了放款也計劃從慈善基金會籌集資金。

sentences.english: They are also looked down upon by your FICO credit score and other lenders.
sentences.chinese: 他們也看不起你的信用信用評分，其他放款。

sentences.english: The amount of loans made by a credit union shall not exceed the amount of its ownership capital.
sentences.chinese: 儲蓄互助社放款總額不得超過該社自有資金總額。

sentences.english: Chinese banks lend for commodity purchases with the underlying commodities as collaterals.
sentences.chinese: 中資銀行爲大宗商品購買放款，並以該商品作爲抵押。

sentences.english: Some lenders will look more favorably on your account if illness or job loss affected your finances.
sentences.chinese: 有些放款會囡如果你生病或失業影響到你的財政。

sentences.english: Then you have one loan payment to one lender.
sentences.chinese: 那麼你有一金一貸放款。

sentences.english: The Bank promised to make a loan of twenty thousand pounds to them.
sentences.chinese: 該銀行答應向他們放款兩萬英鎊。

sentences.english: We simply do not know when banks will begin lending again.
sentences.chinese: 我們根本不知道銀行何時會重新開始放款。

sentences.english: It helps to earn a little interest on your money.
sentences.chinese: 這可使你從放款中取得一點利錢。

sentences.english: Do you pay interest on this akun?
Forbes met the stipulated financial targets.
sentences.chinese: 福布斯傳媒也滿足了放款方規定的財務指標。

definition: a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
to lend on interest/to borrow/a loan/leniency/to make excuses/to pardon/to forgive
